TestMetadata.ExamDescription: The KCNA exam covers foundational Kubernetes knowledge, including cluster architecture, scheduling, networking, security best practices, storage, observability tools, service mesh concepts, and cloud-native delivery patterns like GitOps.

Questions.Title: Scheduling - Hard (Q1)
Questions.Question: A Pod is not being scheduled even though nodes have sufficient resources. Logs show "0/5 nodes are available: 5 node(s) had volume node affinity conflict". What could be the cause?

Options.A: The Pod is referencing a non-existent ConfigMap
Options.B: The PVC used requires a volume available in a specific zone not matching the node's labels
Options.D: The Deployment is missing a service definition

Questions.Explanation: Volume node affinity conflict indicates the PersistentVolumeClaim requires volumes in specific zones that do not match node labels, so pods cannot schedule.

Questions.Title: Kubernetes Fundamentals (Q2)
Questions.Question: Which Kubernetes resource ensures that a specific number of pod replicas are always running, even if some fail?

Options.A: DaemonSet
Options.B: Job
Options.D: StatefulSet

Questions.Explanation: ReplicaSet ensures the desired number of pod replicas are always running by replacing failed pods.

Questions.Title: Kubernetes Fundamentals (Q3)
Questions.Question: What is a key difference between a Job and a CronJob in Kubernetes?

Options.A: A CronJob can run continuously, whereas a Job is only for one-time execution
Options.B: A CronJob manages Job executions on a time-based schedule
Options.C: A Job runs on a schedule while CronJob runs once
Options.D: Job requires manual triggering, CronJob does not

Questions.Explanation: CronJob schedules Jobs to run periodically at specified times, unlike Job which runs once.
